item.title: Report E-2023110171
item.description:
Report E-2023110171

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UAD experienced a UN2924 M2488 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor and pallet due to a faulty drum seam. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. The impacted trailer floor was wiped down and cleaned with absorbents. The impacted absorbents, cut up impacted pallet, and PPE were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110104
item.description:
Report E-2023110104

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-14
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately .25 gallons of Barr Klean Strip Acetone (UN1090) were released from (1) cardboard box containing (4) 1-gallon metal cans due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. It was determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE and oil dri available on site. (1) 20 gallon DM contains Cardboard, (4) 1-gallon metal cans with product, oil dri of waste was created and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

UPON RETRIEVING PACKAGE AND INSPECTING, DESIGNATED RESPONDER FOUND THAT CANS OF PAINT WERE PLACED IN BOX THAT WAS LARGER AND THEN FILLED IN WITH PLASTIC WRAP AND PLASTIC BAG DEBRIS. RESPONDER DISCOVERED ONE CAN HAD LEAKED FROM THE LID.

item.title: Report X-2023110101
item.description:
Report X-2023110101

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: ROSEVILLE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package was discovered by package handlers while unloading and QA was notified. QA collected the package and placed it in a plastic-lined hazmat tote. DescribePack: The bucket has a 4-inch crack in its base. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA was notified of the leaking hazmat the package was collected and placed in a plastic-lined hazmat tote. Any spillage was then cleaned up and the tote was brought back to the QA square for processing.

Was placed in a hazmat and tote DescribePack: the failure was due to mishandling of the package was caused it to crack DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: to mitigate the release item was placed in a hazmat bag and drum

item.description:
Report X-2023110087

  • City: SACRAMENTO

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET AND LEAKING ON BOTTOM. DescribePack: PLASTIC PAIL DROPPED ONTO STRUCTURAL ANCHOR BOLT CAUSING A PUNCTURE. QUARTER INCH HOLE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND SMALL BROOM AND DUSTER. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023110076
item.description:
Report X-2023110076

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found in the unload; upon inspection the bottom and side flaps were discovered wet. Package was then placed in a red hazardous bin layered with absorbent sheets and into a clear hazardous materials bag. DescribePack: The package had no visible wet marks, but it did feel damp when further inspecting the box. Upon inner inspection the inner packing was found wet where the lid of the pail is located. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent sheets were used to clean and pick up the package. No release of liquid occurred besides the small amount coming out from the lid.

Report X-2023110074

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING INSIDE TRAILER MANAGEMENT WAS INFORMED DescribePack: LOOSE BOTTLE CAP INSIDE BOX DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS REMOVED FROM AREA AND PLACED AT HAZMAT AREA

item.title: Report X-2023110072
item.description:
Report X-2023110072

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was called out leaking in the unload and upon arrival it was discovered as a hazmat. A red hazardous bin layered with absorbent, a clear hazardous materials bag, and another layer of absorbent was used to pick up the package. DescribePack: The outer top flaps of the box were found wet. Upon inner inspection, 3 out of the 4 bottles were found bent from the body and the caps were also loose. The labels on the bottles were also soiled and damaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent sheets were used to cover up the top flaps of the box and placed in the red hazardous bin since the leakage didn't spread beyond the box itself. Sheets used were also placed inside the clear hazardous materials bag.

item.title: Report X-2023110071
item.description:
Report X-2023110071

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package made its way to the station when unloading the package was leaking from being smashed from other packages. DescribePack: The containers lids were leaking from the pressure of the packages on top of it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a hazmat bag as well as put into a hazmat tote to be inspected.

item.title: Report X-2023110059
item.description:
Report X-2023110059

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: WINDSOR
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was found by a driver of belt two wet this morning around 8:12am was was place in a line tote. QA was notify about the Hazmat pkg and brought to the Hazmat cage. DescribePack: Upon inspection two of the bottles of liquid machine detergent caps were loose and came off and spilled. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was place in a line tote and brought to the Hazmat cage for process.

item.title: Report X-2023110043
item.description:
Report X-2023110043

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon arrival the box was found with a strong smell of gas. The bottom of the box had wet corners, so it was then placed in a clear hazardous materials bag and then into red hazardous bin layered with absorbent. DescribePack: Upon inspection the bottom flaps of the box were found wet. The inner top corner flaps and the slotted partitions were also found wet. When removing the partitions, one of the bottles was found with a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Most of the leakage happened inside the box but absorbent sheets were used around the area the box was found. The package was then placed in a clear hazardous materials bag and into a red hazardous bin layered with absorbent.

  • Description: CLERK INFORMED ME THEY SUSPECT THE PACKAGES TO BE UNDECLARED BASED ON THE SHIPPER'S INFORMATION. AFTER INSPECTION OF THE SUSPICIOUS PACKAGES IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THEY WERE COMPRESSED FEUL FOR TORCHES. SHIPPER PLACED THE DG INSIDE AN INSIDE-OUT BOX TO HIDE THE DIOMOND LABELS. CONTACTED HAZMAT HELP DESK FOR UNDECLARED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1Z3R4A250391055678 AND 1Z3R4A250398107706. INNER BOXES STATE UN3161 WITH CLASS 2.1 FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND.
